request.description:
Send VCARD

Parameter: {string} chatId '000000000000@c.us'
Parameter: {string} vcard vcard as a string, you can send multiple contacts vcard also.
Parameter: {string} contactName The display name for the contact. Ignored on multiple vcards
Parameter: {string} contactNumber If supplied, this will be injected into the vcard (VERSION 3 ONLY FROM VCARDJS) with the WA id to make it show up with the correct buttons on WA. The format of this param should be including country code, without any other formating. e.g:
`4477777777777`
 Ignored on multiple vcards
[External Documentation](https://docs.openwa.dev/classes/api_Client.Client.html#sendVCard)

request.description:
A list of participants in the chat who have their live location on. If the chat does not exist, or the chat does not have any contacts actively sharing their live locations, it will return false. If it's a chat with a single contact, there will be only 1 value in the array if the contact has their livelocation on.
Please note. This should only be called once every 30 or so seconds. This forces the phone to grab the latest live location data for the number. This can be used in conjunction with onLiveLocation (this will trigger onLiveLocation).
Parameter: chatId string Id of the chat you want to force the phone to get the livelocation data for.
@returns `Promise<LiveLocationChangedEvent >` | boolean
[External Documentation](https://docs.openwa.dev/classes/api_Client.Client.html#forceUpdateLiveLocation)

A list of participants in the chat who have their live location on. If the chat does not exist, or the chat does not have any contacts actively sharing their live locations, it will return false. Please note. This should only be called once every 30 or so seconds. This forces the phone to grab the latest live location data for the number. This can be used in conjunction with onLiveLocation (this will trigger onLiveLocation).
Parameter: chatId string Id of the chat you want to force the phone to get the livelocation data for.

request.description:
Sends a text message to given chat that includes mentions.
In order to use this method correctly you will need to send the text like this:
"@4474747474747 how are you?"
Basically, add a @ symbol before the number of the contact you want to mention.

Parameter: to chat id: `xxxxx@c.us`
Parameter: content text message
Parameter: hideTags Removes all tags within the message
Parameter: mentions You can optionally add an array of contact IDs to tag only specific people
[External Documentation](https://docs.openwa.dev/classes/api_Client.Client.html#sendTextWithMentions)

request.description:
{@license:insiders@}

Send advanced buttons with media body. This is an insiders feature for MD accounts.

:::caution

 Button messages are being progressively handicapped by recipient mobile devices. Some recipients may not see some types of button messages even though their devices will receive them.

:::

Body can be location, image, video or document. Buttons can be quick reply, url or call buttons.

Parameter:  {ChatId} to chat id
Parameter:  {string | LocationButtonBody} body The body of the buttons message
Parameter:  {AdvancedButton} buttons Array of buttons - limit is 3!
Parameter:  {string} title The title/header of the buttons message
Parameter:  {string} footer The footer of the buttons message
Parameter:  {string} filename Required if body is a file!!
[External Documentation](https://docs.openwa.dev/classes/api_Client.Client.html#sendAdvancedButtons)

body.raw:
{
    "args": {
        "to": "00000000000@c.us or 00000000000-111111111@g.us",
        "file": "Check documentation in description",
        "filename": "string",
        "caption": "Hello World!",
        "quotedMsgId": "false_447123456789@c.us_9C4D0965EA5C09D591334AB6BDB07FEB",
        "waitForId": "boolean",
        "ptt": "boolean",
        "withoutPreview": "boolean",
        "hideTags": "boolean",
        "viewOnce": "boolean",
        "requestConfig": "Check documentation in description"
    }
}

request.description:
Sends a image to given chat, with caption or not, using base64
Parameter: to chat id `xxxxx@c.us`
Parameter: file DataURL data:image/xxx;base64,xxx or the RELATIVE (should start with `./` or `../`) path of the file you want to send. With the latest version, you can now set this to a normal URL (for example [GET] `https://file-examples-com.github.io/uploads/2017/10/file_example_JPG_2500kB.jpg`).
Parameter: filename string xxxxx
Parameter: caption string xxxxx
Parameter: waitForKey boolean default: false set this to true if you want to wait for the id of the message. By default this is set to false as it will take a few seconds to retrieve to the key of the message and this waiting may not be desirable for the majority of users.
Parameter: hideTags boolean default: false [INSIDERS] set this to try silent tag someone in the caption
@returns `Promise <boolean | string>` This will either return true or the id of the message. It will return true after 10 seconds even if waitForId is true
[External Documentation](https://docs.openwa.dev/classes/api_Client.Client.html#sendImage)

request.description:
Sends a file to given chat, with caption or not, using base64. This is exactly the same as sendImage

Please note that any file that resolves to mime-type `octet-stream` will, by default, resolve to an MP4 file.

If you want a specific filetype, then explcitly select the correct mime-type from https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml


Parameter: to chat id `xxxxx@c.us`
Parameter: file DataURL data:image/xxx;base64,xxx or the RELATIVE (should start with `./` or `../`) path of the file you want to send. With the latest version, you can now set this to a normal URL (for example [GET] `https://file-examples-com.github.io/uploads/2017/10/file_example_JPG_2500kB.jpg`).
Parameter: filename string xxxxx
Parameter: caption string xxxxx With an [INSIDERS LICENSE-KEY](https://gum.co/open-wa?tier=Insiders%20Program) you can also tag people in groups with `@[numbe`. For example if you want to mention the user with the number `44771234567`, just add `@44771234567` in the caption.
Parameter: quotedMsgId string true_0000000000@c.us_JHB2HB23HJ4B234HJB to send as a reply to a message
Parameter: waitForId boolean default: false set this to true if you want to wait for the id of the message. By default this is set to false as it will take a few seconds to retrieve to the key of the message and this waiting may not be desirable for the majority of users.
Parameter: ptt boolean default: false set this to true if you want to send the file as a push to talk file.
Parameter: withoutPreview boolean default: false set this to true if you want to send the file without a preview (i.e as a file). This is useful for preventing auto downloads on recipient devices.
Parameter: hideTags boolean default: false [INSIDERS] set this to try silent tag someone in the caption
@returns `Promise <boolean | MessageId>` This will either return true or the id of the message. It will return true after 10 seconds even if waitForId is true
[External Documentation](https://docs.openwa.dev/classes/api_Client.Client.html#sendFile)

}

Parameter: messageId: message id of the message to forward. Please note that if it is not loaded, this will return false - even if it exists.
@returns `Promise<MessageId | boolean>`
[External Documentation](https://docs.openwa.dev/classes/api_Client.Client.html#ghostForward)

Any potential abuse of this method will see it become paywalled.

Parameter: messageId: message id of the message to forward. Please note that if it is not loaded, this will return false - even if it exists.

[External Documentation](https://docs.openwa.dev/classes/api_Client.Client.html#ghostForward)

request.description:
Joins a group via the invite link, code, or message
Parameter: link This param is the string which includes the invite link or code. The following work:
- Follow this link to join my WA group: https://chat.whatsapp.com/DHTGJUfFJAV9MxOpZO1fBZ
- https://chat.whatsapp.com/DHTGJUfFJAV9MxOpZO1fBZ
- DHTGJUfFJAV9MxOpZO1fBZ

 If you have been removed from the group previously, it will return `401`

Parameter: returnChatObj boolean When this is set to true and if the group was joined successfully, it will return a serialzed Chat object which includes group information and metadata. This is useful when you want to immediately do something with group metadata.


@returns `Promise<string | boolean | number>` Either false if it didn't work, or the group id.
[External Documentation](https://docs.openwa.dev/classes/api_Client.Client.html#joinGroupViaLink)

request.description:
This allows you to get a single property of a single object from the session. This limints the amouunt of data you need to sift through, reduces congestion between your process and the session and the flexibility to build your own specific getters.

Example - get message read state (ack):

```javascript
const ack  = await client.getSingleProperty('Msg',"true_12345678912@c.us_9C4D0965EA5C09D591334AB6BDB07FEB",'ack')
```
Parameter: namespace
Parameter: id id of the object to get from the specific namespace
Parameter: property the single property key to get from the object.
@returns any If the property or the id cannot be found, it will return a 404
[External Documentation](https://docs.openwa.dev/classes/api_Client.Client.html#getSingleProperty)

request.description:
This function takes an image (including animated GIF) and sends it as a sticker to the recipient. This is helpful for sending semi-ephemeral things like QR codes.
The advantage is that it will not show up in the recipients gallery. This function automatiicaly converts images to the required webp format.
Parameter: to: The recipient id.
Parameter: image: [[DataURL]], [[Base64]], URL (string GET), Relative filepath (string), or Buffer of the image
[External Documentation](https://docs.openwa.dev/classes/api_Client.Client.html#sendImageAsSticker)

request.description:
[REQUIRES A TEXT STORY LICENSE-KEY](https://gum.co/open-wa)

Sends a formatted text story.
Parameter: text The text to be displayed in the story
Parameter: textRgba The colour of the text in the story in hex format, make sure to add the alpha value also. E.g "#FF00F4F2"
Parameter: backgroundRgba  The colour of the background in the story in hex format, make sure to add the alpha value also. E.g "#4FF31FF2"
Parameter: font The font of the text to be used in the story. This has to be a number. Each number refers to a specific predetermined font. Here are the fonts you can choose from:
0: Sans Serif
1: Serif
2: [Norican Regula(https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Norican)
3: [Bryndan Writ(https://www.dafontfree.net/freefonts-bryndan-write-f160189.htm)
4: [Bebasneue Regula(https://www.dafont.com/bebas-neue.font)
5: [Oswald Heavy](https://www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/oswald)
@returns `Promise<string | boolean>` returns status id if it worked, false if it didn't
[External Documentation](https://docs.openwa.dev/classes/api_Client.Client.html#postTextStatus)

request.description:
Clears all chats of all messages. This does not delete chats. Please be careful with this as it will remove all messages from whatsapp web and the host device. This feature is great for privacy focussed bots.

Parameter: ts number A chat that has had a message after ts (epoch timestamp) will not be cleared.

[External Documentation](https://docs.openwa.dev/classes/api_Client.Client.html#clearAllChats)

request.description:
This simple function halves the amount of messages in your session message cache. This does not delete messages off your phone. If over a day you've processed 4000 messages this will possibly result in 4000 messages being present in your session.
Calling this method will cut the message cache to 2000 messages, therefore reducing the memory usage of your process.
You should use this in conjunction with `getAmountOfLoadedMessages` to intelligently control the session message cache.
[External Documentation](https://docs.openwa.dev/classes/api_Client.Client.html#cutMsgCache)

request.description:
Update registered events for a specific webhook. This will override all existing events. If you'd like to remove all listeners from a webhook, consider using [[removeWebhook]].

In order to update authentication details for a webhook, remove it completely and then reregister it with the correct credentials.
[External Documentation](https://docs.openwa.dev/classes/api_Client.Client.html#updateWebhook)

request.description:
The client can now automatically handle webhooks. Use this method to register webhooks.

Parameter: url The webhook url
Parameter: events An array of [[SimpleListene] enums or `all` (to register all possible listeners)
Parameter: requestConfig {} By default the request is a post request, however you can override that and many other options by sending this parameter. You can read more about this parameter here: https://github.com/axios/axios#request-config
Parameter: concurrency the amount of concurrent requests to be handled by the built in queue. Default is 5.
@returns A webhook object. This will include a webhook ID and an array of all successfully registered Listeners.
[External Documentation](https://docs.openwa.dev/classes/api_Client.Client.html#registerWebhook)
